desc: Use react higher-order components:
- Use Route and the render attribute of Route to create Global template, Login Template
- Use Formik to get value from input, the Editor value of tiny MCE

Use Axios and redux saga to communicate with Backend to handle client actions like: get all projects, login, create new project, update project detail, get comments, assign/remove members of a project…
Use localStorage (setItem, getItem) to store and get logined user data (accessToken, id, name,… etc,.), that to check user’s authorization when communicate with Backend
Use redux saga to handle state, onClick, onChange, onSubmit…
Use Ant Design to support building layout, popup, drawer... faster
Use withFormik, Yup to get input value, to validation check
React function component, React Hooks
Libraries: axios, redux saga, ant design, Formik, Yup, tiny MCE, react router DOM, Bootstrap 5.0
Use react higher-order components (Route and the render attribute of Route) to create Global template. Base on that can easy to create a lot of different templates when render a page component
Use JSON files (array and object) to optimize code lines when render component
Use redux-saga to handle state, onClick, onChange. And to optimize code lines when render popup to show the detail of a project
Use react-spring to make animations for components
